newsitem.title: USA: Dow trims losses, NYSE lifts curbs in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Dow trims losses, NYSE lifts curbs in late trade.

text.p: U.S. blue chips trimmed their losses in choppy late trading on Monday, leading the New York Stock Exchange to lift its curbs on program trading.
The Dow was off about 14 at 7907, after profit-taking had dropped the blue chip gauge to the day's low at 7860.
Trading curbs were lifted at 1547 EDT/1947 GMT.
Tech stocks remained the day's feature amid swings in blue chips. Analysts said investors bid up tech shares in anticipation of strong second-quarter earnings reports.
The Nasdaq Composite headed for its eigth consecutive record closing high, up 19 at 1522.
